page.title: 14The Boat by the Parrett.
page.content: On the common by the River Parrett rests a huge boat.The {boat}is 52 feet high ( from keel to mast ) 45 feet long and 12 feet wide weighing 13 tonnes,is being built by Mr.Williams. He began in 1976 using concrete blocks and a basket work of steel to shape the hull{.Mr.Williams}is using an{American}award winning design. To date it has cost Â£25,000 and many hours of hard work and patience.The {boat}is also made of wood,metal and fibre_glass. It is a six berth{boat} and should be ready for its maiden voyage in the spring of 1986.No one has helped{Mr.Williams}apart from two specialists from London.He has built other{boats}by hand but this one will have 9 sails.To test the{boat {Mr.Williams}intends to{sail}to Portugal,then round Gt.Britain,then perhaps round the world.
